page.title: 11Carlisle Citadel Station(i)
page.content: {__>_ "WE'RE GETTING THERE" __>_ {_<__ _<__} Citadel Station opened in 1848 and was doubled in size in the 1870's when the Victoria Viaduct was built to take the road over the lines.The glass roof covers seven acres; today's electric and diesel locos don't obscure it with soot.Badges of the Lancaster&Carlisle and Caledonian Companies can be seen above the entrance. Carlisle is an{open}station. There are no barriers or ticket collectors on the platform. BR rely on their Guards (on InterCity trains at least) to check passengers' tickets.VDU's have been installed above the platforms but are not yet operational so train info. comes from posters, porters, tannoy announcements, or the enquiry office. { __>_} {See p12 _<__
